title: ASL 10.2 — Audience Q&A: Moderation, Clarify, Time-Box ⏱️
objectives: Moderate a Q&A using clear turn-taking and hand-offs
Time-box questions and close Q&A smoothly

vocab.def: Assign turns with index; flat hand for pause.
C-hand near ear or palm-circle AGAIN.
UNDERSTAND wiggle; brief paraphrase + brow position.
Short gloss of question before answer.
Show time, count-down fingers, final signal.

sections.heading: 1) Flow Template
sections.body: Opener → take hands → pick **YOU-NEXT** → **SUMMARY** question → answer → brief follow-up → next. Keep eye gaze steady; show clear **HOLD/WAIT** when needed.

sections.heading: 2) Make Questions Audible (Visible)
sections.body: Always **repeat-back** the question in short gloss so all see it: **QUESTION: CLASS ACCESS HOW?** Then answer.

sections.heading: 3) Clarify Fast
sections.body: **PLEASE REPEAT** / **CLARIFY** with one keyword. If multi-part, list **1–2–3** and answer in that order.

sections.heading: 4) Time-Boxing
sections.body: Signal limits visually: **TWO-MORE**, then **LAST**. Use a **button line**: **Q&A FINISH, THANK-YOU. NEXT, SOCIAL OUTSIDE.**

sections.heading: 5) Partner Drill
sections.body: A moderates, B and C ask. Include: one **repeat-back**, one **clarify**, one **time-box** close. Rotate roles.

items.q: Best order for handling a question:
Gloss a 2-line close for Q&A with a final ‘thank you’ and next action.

items.prompt: Which was hardest—repeat-back, clarifying, or closing on time? Why?

reflectionPrompt: Record 20–30s moderating: pick a question, repeat-back, answer, then time-box with **LAST** and close.
summary: You moderated Q&A using repeat-backs, concise clarifications, and visible time-boxing with a clean close.
